# Recipe: Instapot Broccoli Cheese Soup

- [Introduction](#introduction)

- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)

- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Instapot Broccoli Cheese Soup is a creamy and comforting soup that is perfect for chilly days. This soup combines the goodness of fresh broccoli, rich cheese, and flavorful seasonings. It is a popular dish in many cuisines and is loved by both kids and adults.

## Ingredients
- 4 cups fresh broccoli florets
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 4 cups vegetable or chicken broth
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper

## Equipment
- Instant Pot or pressure cooker
- Cutting board and knife
- Wooden spoon or spatula
- Blender or immersion blender

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 15 minutes (plus time for the Instant Pot to come to pressure)

## Steps
1. Turn on the Instant Pot and select the sauté function. Add the butter and let it melt.
2. Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the Instant Pot. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion becomes translucent.
3. Add the flour to the Instant Pot and stir well to coat the onions and garlic. Cook for another minute to cook off the raw flour taste.
4. Pour in the vegetable or chicken broth and stir to combine. Add the broccoli florets, salt, and black pepper.
5. Close the Instant Pot lid and set the valve to the sealing position. Select the manual/pressure cook function and set the timer for 5 minutes on high pressure.
6. Once the cooking time is complete, do a quick pressure release by carefully turning the valve to the venting position.
7. Open the Instant Pot lid and use an immersion blender or regular blender to blend the soup until smooth and creamy.
8. Return the blended soup to the Instant Pot and select the sauté function again. Pour in the milk and stir well.
9. Add the shredded cheddar cheese to the soup and stir until melted and well combined.
10. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning if needed.
11. Serve the Instapot Broccoli Cheese Soup hot with a sprinkle of shredded cheese on top.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the soup as a starter or main course with crusty bread or garlic bread on the side.
- Pair it with a fresh salad for a complete meal.

## Variations
- Add cooked diced chicken or crispy bacon for added protein and flavor.
- Replace the cheddar cheese with other types of cheese like Gruyere or Swiss for a different taste.
- Add a pinch of cayenne pepper or a dash of hot sauce for a spicy kick.

## Tips and Tricks
- Be sure to cut the broccoli florets into small pieces for quicker cooking and easier blending.
- Use an immersion blender directly in the Instant Pot for convenience, or transfer the soup to a regular blender in batches for a smoother consistency.
- If the soup is too thick, add a little more milk or broth to thin it out to your desired consistency.

## Nutritional Information
- **Calories:** 250 per serving
- **Fat:** 15g
- **Protein:** 12g
- **Carbohydrates:** 20g
- **Fiber:** 4g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat the soup on the stovetop over low heat, stirring occasionally, until heated through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use frozen broccoli instead of fresh?
   - Yes, you can use frozen broccoli if you don't have fresh. Just make sure to thaw it before adding it to the Instant Pot.

2. Can I use a different type of cheese?
   - Absolutely! Feel free to experiment with different cheeses to find your favorite combination.

3. Can I make this soup on the stovetop instead of using an Instant Pot?
   - Yes, you can make this soup on the stovetop by following the same steps. Just cook the soup for about 20-25 minutes until the broccoli is tender.

4. Can I freeze this soup?
   - While it is possible to freeze this soup, the texture may change slightly upon thawing. It is best enjoyed fresh, but if you do freeze it, make sure to thaw and reheat it gently on the stovetop.
